channel.title: Hyperion (previously rs2 framework)
channel.description:
[b]First of all:[/b]
If you cannot set your PATH, or have no concept of what the PATH is, this server is not for you.
This is a repost of my post on another forum.
IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR A COMPLETE SERVER, THIS IS NOT FOR YOU.
To be honest I don't think much will come out of it here, however, it's to stop people reposting in my name (which has happened before - the user 'Shard Revolutions' is not me!). Some of the smarter ones may be interested to look at some of the new concepts in this server. It also addresses all of the known issues in rs2d and contains lots of documentation on the walking and updating systems for those interested in developing their own servers.
[b]--------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/b]
[b]Introduction[/b]
Over the past few days I've been working on this little project which is probably one of the most powerful frameworks that is in existence for RuneScape privatee servers. I've thinked about the design of the core parts of the server and came up with a few unique solutions to help improve performance.
It's around the same level/same style as rs2d, but without some of the bugs (can't guarantee it's bug free yet!!!).
[b]General Overview[/b]
The source uses Apache MINA. William has done some testing (thanks!) and it appears that the packet spamming bug is no longer present (due to a few things I've changed). At the moment it uses version 2.0, milestone 6. When a more stable version comes out (such as the release candidate or proper version), I'd encourage you all to upgrade however I have noticed no significant problems with using it so far.
There is one unit test (in the test/ folder). Might add more as the source gets more complicated.
Everything with the exception of the ISAAC cipher code has been written from scratch.
[b]Credits[/b]
- Me - for writing it - William - testing/ideas - Sean - testing/ideas - Blake - had similar ideas ages ago but we never implemented them in anything - he also wants to help develop it further! :)
[b]Benchmark[/b]
I've done some testing and it seems the server can handle 2000 players without crashing. However, this is [b]not real players so not accurate[/b]. Also, bear in mind the server in fact has very few features and this will have an impact on performance (as in a real server if you had 2000 players they would be performing actions).
For those interested in how the benchmark was setup, the SYI attacker was run on the same PC as the server. The PC is dual core, 2.2ghz. With the way in which the server is setup it would perform better on more cores, as not just the input/output is done in a multi-threaded manner. The throttle filter was disabled. With it enabled, they will connect slowly. Also, there is no limit per IP yet.
While this number of players are online, the server is still useable (logins are slower than normal - as expected - but there isn't much lag).
Now, here are some details of the exact optimizations that have been put in place:
[b]Caching update blocks[/b]
Say you had 100 players in a region, and then a new one logs in. In a traditional server, each 100 players will reconstruct the new player's appearance update block when they login. This server will cache update blocks for the duration of the cycle, so it only happens once, at the expense of slightly more memory usage.
This should give some improvements when there are a lot of players in an area, especially if the updates are large (like appearance blocks).
[b]Pooling player updating[/b]
Player updating is a read only task. This means you can execute it in multiple threads safely. The server creates a thread pool with the same number of cores as the current computer it is running on, and dispatches update tasks to this pool.
To prevent threading issues, the main thread will block until all the updates are complete. Then the main thread may run as usual, processing packets and performing reads and writes safely with little worry of thread-safety.
This can give vast improvements when you have a PC with multiple cores and/or processors. If you look at the screenshot above, which was taken on a dual core PC, the server is using around 80% of the CPU which means it is taking advantage of both cores (otherwise it would be at or below 50%).
There are classes allowing you to do this as well (namely the ParallelTask class), however, there are few remaining cases in which this is possible to do safely.
[b]When the server is idle, it really is idle[/b]
A final performance optimization, that has more impact on other processes running on your server, is the fact that unlike rs2d (or rs2d iirc?) it does not 'tick' every 30ms or so.
At the core of the server, is one main thread which has a BlockingQueue of pending tasks. It continually takes events off the queue and processes them. When there are no tasks to process, this blocks, allowing other processes to do their stuff.
[b]Different thread for loading and saving players[/b]
Players are loaded and saved in a different thread meaning if the disk is busy, the main thread will not be interrupted.
[b]Event management and all the other standard 'good stability' stuff[/b]
It has an event manager (look into World.getWorld().submit(Event event) that should be more efficient than the others people may have seen in my previous servers. It operates directly on a ScheduledExecutorService (the same executor service that tasks get submitted to) meaning it is thread safe and pretty accurate. process() doesn't even exist (the equivalent is TickTask but please use an event instead!).
[b]Documentation[/b]
javadocs are in the source.
The source is also documented heavily in updating and walking, which most people may be interested in looking at.
[b]Features[/b]
In terms of features, it is pretty bare. It's for you lot to build upon, however, I have plans to continue developing this along with Blake.
Here's the list:
[ul][*]Login (duh!) [*]Rendering [*]Walking [*]Multiplayer [*]Public chat [*]Commands (::tele only atm)[/ul]
[b]Download[/b]
Old (r269):
[s][B][url=http://uppit.com/v/RDLJONFQ]http://uppit.com/v/RDLJONFQ[/url][/B][/s] [s][b][url=http://drop.io/hyperion_r269]http://drop.io/hyperion_r269[/url][/b][/s] [B][url=http://www.multiupload.com/59TKCOIXKS]http://www.multiupload.com/59TKCOIXKS[/url][/B] (there ARE two ones linked from multiupload which work still, however, the preferred way to get it is via Subversion:)
CURRENT REVISION 276 [b]http://rapidshare.com/files/434962916/Hyperion.zip[/b] [b]http://uppit.com/mv5ro3n1zqpw/Hyperion.zip[/b]
[code] mkdir /where/you/want/to/save/hyperion svn co http://subversion.assembla.com/svn/hyperion_server/trunk/ /where/you/want/to/save/hyperion [/code]
[b]License:[/b]
[code] Copyright (c) 2009 The Hyperion Development Team
Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:
The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all copies or substantial portions of the Software.
THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE SOFTWARE. [/code]
[b]How do I compile?[/b]
You can use Apache Ant ([url=http://ant.apache.org/]http://ant.apache.org/[/url]) or an IDE. Or write the batch files yourself if you feel so inclined.
[b]How do I run?[/b]
Set your PATH, then use the batch file or ant script.
[b]Subversion repository[/b]
As myself and Blake might be doing further development on this source, here is the link:
[url=http://subversion.assembla.com/svn/hyperion_server/trunk/]http://subversion.assembla.com/svn/hyperion_server/trunk/[/url]
This gives read only access only: no username or password is necessary.

item.title: Hyperion (previously rs2 framework)
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

Build.xml

<project name="hyperion" default="compile" basedir=".">
	<property name="src" location="src" />
	<property name="build" location="build" />
	<property name="lib" location="lib" />
	<property name="jar" location="hyperion.jar" />

	<target name="compile">
		<delete file="${jar}" />
		<delete dir="${build}" />
		<mkdir dir="${build}"/>
		<javac srcdir="${src}" destdir="${build}" debug="on" target="1.5">
		  <classpath>
			<pathelement location="${lib}/jython.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/commons-compress-1.0.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/slf4j-api-1.5.8.jar"/>
			<pathelement location="${lib}/mina-core-2.0.0-M6.jar"/>
			<pathelement location="${lib}/junit-4.6.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/slf4j-jdk14-1.5.8.jar" />
			<pathelement path="${java.class.path}/"/>
		  </classpath>
		</javac>
		<jar basedir="${build}" destfile="${jar}" />
	</target>
	
	<target name="runserver">
		<java classname="org.hyperion.Server" fork="true">
			<jvmarg value="-Xms512m" />
			<jvmarg value="-Xmx1024m" />
			<classpath>
			<pathelement location="${lib}/jython.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/commons-compress-1.0.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/slf4j-api-1.5.8.jar"/>
			<pathelement location="${lib}/mina-core-2.0.0-M6.jar"/>
			<pathelement location="${lib}/junit-4.6.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/slf4j-jdk14-1.5.8.jar" />
			<pathelement path="${jar}/" />
			</classpath>
		</java>
	</target>
</project>

Compile.bat

@echo off
set PATH=%PATH%;C:\apache-ant-1.8.?\bin
set JAVA_HOME=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_??
ant compile
pause

runserver.bat

title Hyperion
set PATH=%PATH%;C:\apache-ant-1.8.?\bin
set JAVA_HOME=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_??
ant runserver
pause

Compiling will output a jar file to run from.

Read full topic

item.title: Hyperion (previously rs2 framework)
item.dc:creator: @TheNewCoder TheNewCoder
item.description:
@TheNewCoder wrote:

Graham:

It doesn’t have a process() method (the equivalent is the TickTask however putting your code there is a bad idea due to the multi-threaded updating system) and there is already an event manager integrated.

Sounds great!

Read full topic
